system_owner.role: Orchestrator and first line of defense

team_structure.note: Researcher specialist not included in this example (see singular/researcher-crewai for complete Researcher profile)

key_design_decisions: System Owner always active (first line of defense)
Clear boundaries between specialists (Researcher=validation, Domain Linguist=terminology)
Explicit attribution in synthesis (Researcher confirms, Domain Linguist clarifies)
Routing logic based on request substance not surface keywords
Multi-specialist coordination when questions span domains
Specialist autonomy within delegated scope (System Owner doesn't micromanage)
use_cases: Complex CrewAI questions requiring both validation and terminology clarity
Multi-faceted research questions benefiting from specialist collaboration
Situations where single expert insufficient for comprehensive answer
advantages_over_singular: Deeper expertise in narrow domains vs broad shallow coverage
Clearer separation of concerns (validation vs terminology)
Specialists can work in parallel when independent
System Owner provides consistent orchestration logic
Easier to add new specialists without modifying existing profiles

use_composite_when: Domain is large enough to benefit from specialization
Team collaboration adds value beyond single expert
Coordination overhead justified by depth gains
use_singular_when: Domain is cohesive and not easily divisible
Overhead of coordination exceeds depth benefits
Single expert can cover breadth and depth adequately
Simpler deployment and maintenance is priority
